TopicTitle: What's the best Soviet rocket parts mod?

Articles.Content:
The stock Kerbal parts are very NASA, which is nice and good, but the Soviet / Russian space program deserves some love too. After all I grew up on the heroic story of Yuri Gagarin.

So with the several Soviet mods out there, some in various stages of disrepair (makes you think of the Yeltsin-era ), I'm wondering which one is the most complete / polished?
KW Rocketry has some R7 style strap on tanks, I use that and HGR's "SoyJuice" and Block I to "roll my own" Soyuz launches (use Procedural Fairings for the Soyuz fairing rather then the HGR one).

And you got http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/88045-0-25-WIP-Soviet-Probes-NOW-WITH-ROCKETS!-v0-94-9-10-14 for Soviet probes and rockets and the N-1 http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79797-N-1-Soviet-Heavy-Booster-%28OLDD-in-USSR%29-v-0-235-%2813-05-14%29?p=1154077&viewfull=1#post1154077 and the Proton http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/220464-ussr-proton-8k82k-m#t1:changes and some of this are being patched http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81754-Release-BobCat-Ind-Space-Planet-products and this are small but nice http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81537-0-24-2-Tantares-Stockalike-Soyuz-and-TKS-9-1-2-Crew-1-25m-Pod-Fobos-Grunt and HGR again small but nice http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67164-HGR-R-D-Thread-Stock-like-Soyuz-Shenzhou-and-1-875m-parts-in-Development.
